title: Governance Parameter Ideation
description: Can we encourage discussion regarding governance, that will result in changes to the funding process prior to the release of Voltaire?

f6_assessments.q0:
Improving the governance of the funding process aligns with the Cardano mission of growing the global Cardano community specifically "it is our responsibility to ensure that robust governance, standards, and ethics exist and are upheld across every touchpoint."
The current funding process has many flaws that are leading to poor untimely decisions on the allocation of resources.
I strongly agree this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
The community has the skills to address the challenge however the challenge is narrowly scoped to "not seek to re-imagine, but evolve on the existing process" which is much less than the community is capable of. As an interim step with a moderate budget this challenge is fine however I believe the Catalyst community is going to evolve at a much faster pace than envisioned in the constraints of this challenge.
I strongly agree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are partially relevant to the challenge question. For $150K, success looks like a To Do list? My expectation would be that success would involve more tangible deliverables.
The key metrics are relevant to the success criteria .
I disagree that the success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: This is very much in alignment with cardano's misson, as governance is the key to establishing a system that will last and will be resilient. It is looking for ways to improve upon, and address current issues people have brought up with voltaire and governance. This is essential to the effectiveness of catalyst as well.
f6_assessments.q1: As members of catalyst, we are currently active in governance and have insight on what governance looks like now, and what it can look like in the future. We have members from all walks of life and in numerous professions that will be able to bring their expertise to this.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe the key metrics proposed would allow us to measure the progress and effectiveness of the challenge, but we ned to provide more guidance and details if this is going to be a challenge. This is a great start, but we need to further define those key metrics, as well as establish a soft timeline to encourage the community to dive into this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The evolution of Catalyst towards Voltaire will require such a challenge category. The sooner the Catalyst community begins to develop tooling for Voltaire, the better.
f6_assessments.q1: This is early stages but I see it a challenge category that could repeat every fund. I believe it will take some time for the community to embrace the building of governance tools, but we must begin somewhere, because this community-developed tooling is essential to the vision of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics given are measurable and will provide a meaningful assessment of the proposal progress.

importance: Well-detailed flaws have already been identified with the proposal process, and distribution of funds, yet the design seems fixed
success: There is a publicly available backlog of changes to the Catalyst process with a timeline, or at the very least scoped and prioritized
